The catch with this "fact" is it's true for any human, but you can further specify "black woman" or "white latino" as you please to make a fun punch :P

body: I'm not sure I follow the reasoning you used to reach that conclusion. (the shortest people lowering the average height).

body: Ehh, I disagree. To be below average you have to be below the 50% threshold, not at the 50% threshold. If everyone has 0 skill in an infinite number of imaginable metrics, everyone's pretty much 50%, or at least 50% of the time. You can also invert metrics which is a simpler proof against your point. So saying "below average in every metric imaginable" is definitely false

body:
On average people have 100 IQ, so if you're above average IQ (i.e. 110), on average you'll marry someone with lower IQ.

From a different standpoint, you can consider that in a marriage couple, one person has higher IQ. Generalize from there.

*****

To your second half of the point, 

> Wouldn't the other half have to be dating/marrying people with higher IQs?

Yes but my "fact" didn't state otherwise :)
body_html:
On average people have 100 IQ, so if you're above average IQ (i.e. 110), on average you'll marry someone with lower IQ.

From a different standpoint, you can consider that in a marriage couple, one person has higher IQ. Generalize from there.

To your second half of the point,

Wouldn't the other half have to be dating/marrying people with higher IQs?

Yes but my "fact" didn't state otherwise :)

body:
Sounds fake, true: You see the opposite color of everything. The explanation is that if something is red, you will see the opposite color because it will be reflected back at you. Likewise black is actually all colors (doesn't reflect anything, think black holes) and white is no color at all (everything is reflected off of it).

Sounds true, fake: Hard work and dedication overcome lack of natural talent. Unfortunately it doesn't and never will. What's more important, the nurture that effects something or the nature that makes it exist in the first place? It seems like we can do anything and that our choices have a major effect on us but in reality genes determine a lot more than we realize, even how happy we're capable of being.

Sounds true, fake: Hard work and dedication overcome lack of natural talent. Unfortunately it doesn't and never will. What's more important, the nurture that effects something or the nature that makes it exist in the first place? It seems like we can do anything and that our choices have a major effect on us but in reality genes determine a lot more than we realize, even how happy we're capable of being.

body:
Alright, since you went there, I'm gonna go there too.

*****

Fact:

> a thing that is known or proved to be true.

Proof:

> an inferential argument [...] showing that the stated assumptions logically guarantee the conclusion [...] every proof can [...] be constructed using [...] original assumptions known as axioms

Axiom:

> a statement that is taken to be true, to serve as a premise or starting point for further reasoning and arguments.

Which looks like a bit of a circular argument (it is), but it means that we have a baseline for things we can call "true" and build facts off of. Facts don't mean they're absolute truths; they mean we can derive them from things we accept as truth.

body:
The point is that your basketball player cannot score negative points, at worst (s)he scores zero, while the top performer is not really limited as (s)he can score 50, 100, 150, 200, ... points.

Similarly about height, nobody can grow into negative numbers but at least in theory the upper limit to one's height does not exist.

This imbalance of min and max boundaries means that average is higher than median.
body_html:
The point is that your basketball player cannot score negative points, at worst (s)he scores zero, while the top performer is not really limited as (s)he can score 50, 100, 150, 200, ... points.

Similarly about height, nobody can grow into negative numbers but at least in theory the upper limit to one's height does not exist.

This imbalance of min and max boundaries means that average is higher than median.

But even the worst basketball player on earth isnt a functional zero on the scale either. 

The shortest person on earth isnt 0 feet, 0 inches tall. 

The average human is going to be able to perform some measure of the task above 0, making the average of the bellcurve go further right than not, with a higher peak right than left.

parent.body:
Sounds fake, true: You see the opposite color of everything. The explanation is that if something is red, you will see the opposite color because it will be reflected back at you. Likewise black is actually all colors (doesn't reflect anything, think black holes) and white is no color at all (everything is reflected off of it).

Sounds true, fake: Hard work and dedication overcome lack of natural talent. Unfortunately it doesn't and never will. What's more important, the nurture that effects something or the nature that makes it exist in the first place? It seems like we can do anything and that our choices have a major effect on us but in reality genes determine a lot more than we realize, even how happy we're capable of being.

Sounds true, fake: Hard work and dedication overcome lack of natural talent. Unfortunately it doesn't and never will. What's more important, the nurture that effects something or the nature that makes it exist in the first place? It seems like we can do anything and that our choices have a major effect on us but in reality genes determine a lot more than we realize, even how happy we're capable of being.

body: The second one is basically undeniable in athletics, so most people are willing to accept it there even though it hurts. However people also have different brains just as they have different bodies. It's been proven that changing even a single gene will drastically alter brain structure. Innate talent has been proven to account for about 75% of ability. The brains of very very talented and smart people *look physically different* from everyone elses', even to the naked eye, in ways that couldn't have developed post-natal. And pretty much everything except spatial and motor skills women are going to have a huge advantage over men, especially if it involves making or designing something from scratch. This has been shown by brain scans, because men have less developed cognitive areas, less neurons, and for the most part can only use of the left side of their brain while women use both, which makes sense because men are designed more for labor and fighting. I didn't use to believe any of this but when you've been loving one thing for years and other people just start doing it among a bunch of other things and instantly crush you, you can't really deny it anymore. Genetics determine your brain, and what kind of brain you have determines what you're capable of doing and even perceiving.

Innate talent has been proven to account for about 75% of ability. The brains of very very talented and smart people look physically different from everyone elses', even to the naked eye, in ways that couldn't have developed post-natal. And pretty much everything except spatial and motor skills women are going to have a huge advantage over men, especially if it involves making or designing something from scratch. This has been shown by brain scans, because men have less developed cognitive areas, less neurons, and for the most part can only use of the left side of their brain while women use both, which makes sense because men are designed more for labor and fighting. I didn't use to believe any of this but when you've been loving one thing for years and other people just start doing it among a bunch of other things and instantly crush you, you can't really deny it anymore. Genetics determine your brain, and what kind of brain you have determines what you're capable of doing and even perceiving.

body:
I have a lot to say. 

1. Even tho I am female, I have pretty good motor skills, at least I think so. Also, I'm not very good at seeing color compared to others, even some guys see more color than I do, which is also something females do better than guys.

2. I looked up what you said about how brains look, and I found this https://www.gro-gifted.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/gro-brain-activation.png Just proves your point even further. 

3. If it is genetic, have they figured out which genes cause this?

4. Not to brag, I am one of the "gifted" people, and I'm not sure about my parents. I don't know if they really aren't "gifted" as well, or maybe they weren't shown because of other reasons.

5. I do agree that having a gift is very important, but if you don't cultivate it, then what's the point? I think it will fade away because I don't think it's genetic. (I do, however, don't think its nurture either, I think it's in between)
body_html:
I have a lot to say.

  1. Even tho I am female, I have pretty good motor skills, at least I think so. Also, I'm not very good at seeing color compared to others, even some guys see more color than I do, which is also something females do better than guys.

  2. I looked up what you said about how brains look, and I found this https://www.gro-gifted.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/gro-brain-activation.png Just proves your point even further.

  3. If it is genetic, have they figured out which genes cause this?

  4. Not to brag, I am one of the "gifted" people, and I'm not sure about my parents. I don't know if they really aren't "gifted" as well, or maybe they weren't shown because of other reasons.

  5. I do agree that having a gift is very important, but if you don't cultivate it, then what's the point? I think it will fade away because I don't think it's genetic. (I do, however, don't think its nurture either, I think it's in between)

body:
1. Women do excel in motor skills, just not spatial awareness. However even then, while men are better at awareness of existing objects, women are still usually better at producing them, thus they have superior 3D art and modeling skills. This goes back to when men spent all their time fighting and mating, and the women had to be more intelligent and good at innovating, and also happy so they could nurture children.

2. Yep, it's pretty undeniable

3. Some of them. There are a few "smart genes" that have been identified, and a lot of differences are also linked to X and Y chromosomes. These factors pretty much predict success. There are also happiness genes, which determine at least 50% of how happy you are capable of being, which is why Danes and Dutch tend to be happier than other people, and in general men are also less happy than women (men are the "disposable" sex so their bodies aren't designed with much regard to their own well-being, and they also mate and fight better when they're angry).

4. I'm "gifted" too but in reality I'm just curious and copy the actually smart and creative people. I have no ability of my own as shown by my 100% failure rate. I can't even *start* most of the things I try. In fact I was better off as a child (probably because the non-male parts of my brain weren't fully throttled yet). Just because your parents aren't gifted doesn't mean you can't be. Gifted people can be normal, but not the other way around.

5. It's almost all genetic. Nurture is required, but so is nature. They are BOTH important, but unfortunately one of them you can change and the other one you're stuck with what you've got.
body_html:
1. Women do excel in motor skills, just not spatial awareness. However even then, while men are better at awareness of existing objects, women are still usually better at producing them, thus they have superior 3D art and modeling skills. This goes back to when men spent all their time fighting and mating, and the women had to be more intelligent and good at innovating, and also happy so they could nurture children.

  2. Yep, it's pretty undeniable

  3. Some of them. There are a few "smart genes" that have been identified, and a lot of differences are also linked to X and Y chromosomes. These factors pretty much predict success. There are also happiness genes, which determine at least 50% of how happy you are capable of being, which is why Danes and Dutch tend to be happier than other people, and in general men are also less happy than women (men are the "disposable" sex so their bodies aren't designed with much regard to their own well-being, and they also mate and fight better when they're angry).

  4. I'm "gifted" too but in reality I'm just curious and copy the actually smart and creative people. I have no ability of my own as shown by my 100% failure rate. I can't even start most of the things I try. In fact I was better off as a child (probably because the non-male parts of my brain weren't fully throttled yet). Just because your parents aren't gifted doesn't mean you can't be. Gifted people can be normal, but not the other way around.

  5. It's almost all genetic. Nurture is required, but so is nature. They are BOTH important, but unfortunately one of them you can change and the other one you're stuck with what you've got.
